channel.description: Recent content in ðŸ•¸ Network Attacks on Analyst

item.title: ðŸ“š Technical Reference
item.description: Network Topology It’s a geometric arrangment of hosts and network devices. Can be physical (cables and PCs’ layout) or logical (informaiton transmission methods).

item.title: ðŸ“š Network Anonymity Techniques
item.description: Evasion techniques and what possible forensic footprints they are likely to leave? VPN Virtual private network.

item.title: Firewalls
item.description: Host-based IDS look for local system configurations and behaviour, while network-based IDS look for network connections and looks for anomalies and common signatures.

item.title: DoS Attacks and Mitigations
item.description: In this article, I will cover the main DoS techniques and how they look in the logs. I will also cover some main mitigation techniques.

item.title: Network Recon
item.description: traceroute, tracert On Windows, it’s tracert (due to some legacy max-name-size limitations). On Linux and macOS - traceroute.

item.title: Port Scanning
item.description: There are several techniques for port scanning. Some of them work for one OS only.

item.title: ðŸ“˜ BTFM
item.description: dshell # MacOSX path to directory with pyenv (example): /Users/[user_name]/.pyenv/versions/3.8.5/envs/python3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/dshell/ decode -l # list decoders decode -d [decoder_name] # decoder info # who talked to whom decode -d ip [capture_file_name].
